abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column argues financial and refugee crises sweeping Europe, along with recent terrorism, highlight continent's limitations in addressing such issues in absence of formal political union and attendant institutions; holds European project's attempts to give Europe attributes of single nation without formal union leave many nations adrift in time of trouble; argues United States presents preferable model.
lead_paragraph: The hope for a growing European unity has suffered setbacks amid terrorism, the refugee crisis and financial challenges.
snippet: The hope for a growing European unity has suffered setbacks amid terrorism, the refugee crisis and financial challenges.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
